pros: Great place to work good mgmnt

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Hickory, NC
pros: Pick your own schedule most of the time Not strict with charting or uniforms
cons: Literally everything else. This company is run worse than HCA. This hospital has 90% traveling nurses and only 10% staff.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Hickory, NC
pros: This is a fast-paced environment with engaging tasks. This position gave me a strong sense of purpose and I formed connections with the patients I met every day. The building is newly refurbished, there is a large parking garage adjacent to the building, and there are fun events to show appreciation to all of the workers.
cons: The working environment is very stressful; patients are often in pain and/or upset, every department is understaffed, and the schedulers routinely overbook patients for procedures. A few employees have stated that they got food poisoning from the hospital's cafeteria. The supervisors and upper management have not been trained for the jobs of their supervisees and often make decisions that inhibit the workers. Each worker compensates for two or three positions, so the pay is less than it ought to be.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Hickory, NC
pros: The staff i work with are great people.
cons: I feel that i am drastically underpaid

pros: Great coworkers, benefits, location and overall nice place to work.

review_title: Frye needs a lot of change!
pros: They have some good people there but they are slowly leaving one by one.
cons: We are basically run by workers who are travelers who doesn't care.

pros: Good bosses, good co workers,
cons: Raises are not that good

pros: Flexible schedule, It's a job
cons: Drama, benefits are not up to par. Low pay rate

review_title: Please hear our plea for a stable practice of doctors and a nice cost of living raise !!
pros: The very best in technology, recognition in our heart center (tower), wonderful coworkers, educational opportunities as well as in-house educational classes.
cons: The present physician situation is one of the biggest downsides.  There are so many doctors working within the new hospitalist group, the patients are dissatisfied with some of the doctors and having to see so many diffiferent ones if they have an extended stay.  The payscale is lower than any in this area and the raises given are lower than the standard.  The shortage of nurses and the lack of advertisement in the local newspapers to try to recruit new nurses.  Nurses week was not recognized well this year.   Frye does not give Christmas bonuses as other hospitals do.  They only give a gift card to a local grocery store for $30.00.  Other hospitals are giving $400.00 and $500.00 bonuses.   The badges are terrible.  You can hardly read the names on them (especially if you are elderly).  Can't even see the credentials very well and they are located at the very bottom.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Hickory, NC
pros: Healthcare benefits are okay.  Not great; just okay.  A little expensive and inferior compared to those at my previous job, but definitely better than what some other employers are offering these days.  There are additional optional insurance plans such as dental, vision, short-term and long-term disability.
cons: You aren't told what you are getting into before you go to work for Frye.  They are now affiliated with Duke Lifepoint, which is a very cheap company.   Days off are few and far between.  You don't get paid for holidays, either.  This seems to be a new trend, but it isn't one that will keep nurses.  Orientation is a joke.   Everyone seems clueless about things - I don't mean medical care - I mean information that is shared with employees at other hospitals, such as when raises are to be expected.  My advice is to negotiate your salary.

review_title: Quality medical facility with corporate mentality
pros: Doctors, nurses, and ancillary staff care about their patients. Convenient location close to downtown area of Hickory. Technology  and available diagnostic tools are up-to-date and great for a facility  in a metro area of its size.
cons: the corporation that owned the facility when I last worked there seemed more concerned with budgets and cutting expenses than providing quality patient care by encouraging and providing incentives staff to work as a cohesive team.

pros: I enjoyed being able to do most of my work alone since the environment was mostly negative. It allowed me to get away from it some.
cons: Lacking in support, they hire many new phlebotomist but do not provide the support needed to be successful in this role. Not a team environment. I really wanted to love it but I just couldn’t get past how awful everyone treated each other. I’m sure this is largely due to others being unhappy with pay and environment but I just could get past it myself to be in such a negative environment.

pros: PAY IS OK FOR THE AREA.  12 hour shifts make it nice.  Most employees are very nice and work well with each other.
cons: Management sucks. They only talk to you when they need something and really don't care about you as an individual.Health insurance sucks to.

review_title: A great place to learn and grow as a Physical Therapist and administrator.
job_title: Adminstartive Director of Therapy Services in Hickory, NC
pros: The people! Good benefits, great PTO plan, annual merit raises. The hospital staff daily strive to provide a safe, stable, and competitive care delivery model.
cons: Despite excellent profitability, corporate reinvestment in the local facility has been minimal in last 5 years. This reduces Frye's viability to enhance physician satisfaction, maintain employee satisfaction and successfully compete in a highly aggressive market.

pros: Great coworkers.  Good facility.  Some great departments.
cons: Supervisors would send you home early and exhaust your leave/benefits to do so, or dock pay.  Saw my earnings drop a lot.  Benefits shrank.  I gave up and left.  Hospital sold but stress continues.

pros: Co-workers are great.  Hours are good.
cons: Constant bickering between members of senior management.  Too busy worrying about gaining and protecting their territory.  Trust me, the employees notice.

pros: Great staff, patients are generally nice and respectful, the nursing techs are the best I've ever worked with, it's a pretty clean facility
cons: Pay is not the greatest and scheduling is terrible, your days are rarely in a row and weekends are required, the nurse to pt ratio is a little bit much

review_title: Wonderful support from upper management until last year when parent company instituted so many changes

cons: parent company makes too many changes that should be handled at site level - this impacts trust and encourages competition among peers
